column4: hello all. i need to know my dhcp server address in order to using to configure properly another o.s., someone can help me? thanks
if your on linux: type ifconfig
that ip address isn't exactly right, the inet address is what we need
i haven't an usable external IP address
I'm not trying to find your external ip address, I'm going to guess what your dhcp server address is based upon your computers address
with windows xp it's easy to know ti (ipconfig /all), but i remember it's completely different by ip address
does the computer you're using get it's ip address from your router or whatever you are using for a dhcp server?
ifconfig is the same thing in linux
but doesn't say me which is my dhcp server address, differently by windows
i use linux for 5 years, but it's the first time that i have this trouble
usually it's the lowest number of whatever subnet you are on: eg if your ip address is 192.168.1.105 then your dhcp server would be 192.168.1.1
ok, but: inte addr: 1.237.49.xxx, default gateway addr: 1.237.48.1 ...
I've got to go, sry...hopefully someone else can help
